title: Data Binding (One-way & Two-way)
subject: Angular
theory:
Data binding connects the component logic to the view. 
1. Property Binding [property]="value" (One-way: Source -> View)
2. Event Binding (event)="handler()" (One-way: View -> Source)
3. Two-way Binding [(ngModel)]="value" (Both directions)

examples.output: Button triggers onClick method. Input field shows userName property.

common_mistakes.correction: [(ngModel)] requires importing FormsModule in your module.
common_mistakes.example: Can't bind to 'ngModel' since it isn't a known property of 'input'.

interview_questions.question: What is the syntax for two-way binding?

real_world_use_cases.description: Two-way binding is essential for form inputs where user data must sync with the model immediately.

summary: Mastering bindings `[]`, `()`, and `[()]` is crucial for creating interactive Angular UIs.
